page.title: 03The site of Gorleston.
page.content: The origional site of the town lay in linear form along the present High Street just above the old cliff line of the River Yare and also on the slightly higher land just above the bend of the harbour's mouth. Gorleston centre, where the present library is, lies at the junction of the High Street with Baker Street and Church Lane, which run from the West along a very shallow valley towards the river. Another such valley is followed by England's Lane, to the South. As the town has grown it has spread onto the undulating plain of glacial boulder clay and outwash sands of the Isle of Lothingland rising gently to about ten or fifteen metres above sea level.
